bibl.title: Letter from M.A. Barber to Henry Rose Carter, May 2, 1924

div1.p: Barber sends Carter copies of articles on malaria. LePrince reports that mosquito control on the Mexican border is going well.

div1.head: Letter from M.A. Barber to Henry Rose Carter, May 2, 1924
div1.opener:
Malaria
Russia
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Crowley, La. May 2, 1924.
Dr. H.R. Carter
Assist. Surgeon General, U.S. Public Health Service.
2121 California St. N.W.
Washington,
D.C.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am sending you under separate cover photostat article on
malaria in Russia, Mackenzie, Lancet, and a summary on the same subject in
the Leaugue of Nations Monthly Epidemiological Report.

Dr. Fricks wrote me that you wished some literature on this subject and that
the Memphis copies are now on the road.

I hope you will be coming this way and stop in to see us some
time. We may be in the delta country of Mississippis next year. We had a
good visit yesterday from Mr. Le Prince. He says that the Aedes control
on the Mexican Border is going fine.
